com.echsylon.atlantis

Class Atlantis

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.echsylon.atlantis.Atlantis

  • public class Atlantis
extends Object
    This is the top level orchestration layer, on top of the mock web mockServer, that will serve the mock responses. The web mockServer will only serve mocked responses for requests targeting "localhost".

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Atlantis.TokenHelper
      This interface describes the token helper feature set.
      static interface  Atlantis.TransformationHelper
      This interface describes the API offering means for preparing a request either for the real world or the mock environment.

        See Also:

      • setRecordMissingRequestsEnabled

        public void setRecordMissingRequestsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a boolean flag enabling or disabling recording of missing request templates. This feature can only be enabled if there is a fallback base url set in the Atlantis configuration.

        While this feature is enabled any requests made by the client app that don't have a corresponding request template will be served with a real response instead of the default HTTP 404 "Not found".

        The request will in such case be relayed to the "real" mockServer and the response will be stored on the filesystem and a corresponding request template will be added to the Atlantis configuration. Also an updated copy of the configuration JSON will be written to the same location.

        The recorded requests will be written to the "atlantis" directory in the client apps external files directory

        Parameters:
        enabled - Boolean true to enable the feature, false to disable it.

      • setRecordMissingFailuresEnabled

        public void setRecordMissingFailuresEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a boolean flag enabling or disabling recording of missing request templates that returned with an HTTP error from the real server. This feature can only be enabled if the "record missing requests" feature is enabled.

        The recorded requests will be written to the "atlantis" directory in the client apps external files directory

        Parameters:
        enabled - Boolean true to enable the feature, false to disable it.

      • setRecordServedRequestsEnabled

        public void setRecordServedRequestsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a boolean flag enabling or disabling recording of served request templates.

        While this feature is enabled any requests made by the client app will be recorded. The caller can then at a later point in time fetch the recorded requests and analyze the serve pattern.

        NOTE! The responses are not explicitly tracked. When analyzing the records the caller may still be able to extract mock responses from the request templates but there is no guarantee that they will match the actually served mocked response. It all depends on the response filter associated with the particular request template.

        Parameters:
        enabled - Boolean true to enable the feature, false to disable it.

      • clearServedRequestsRecords

        public void clearServedRequestsRecords()
        Clears the list of served request templates.

      • configuration

        public Configuration configuration()
        Returns the configuration of this Atlantis instance. The caller can use this object to inspect the request templates and any associated mock responses that Atlantis can serve.
        Returns:
        The configuration object.

      • servedRequests

        public List<MockRequest> servedRequests()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of served mock requests. The first item (list position 0) will be the first served request since this feature was enabled and the last item (list position size() - 1) will be the last served request.
        Returns:
        The unmodifiable served mock requests list as per definition in Collections.unmodifiableList(List).
